intro: Cheiranthus scapiger, commonly known as the scapigerous honesty, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in rocky or dry soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
